intro: Isolepis anceps, commonly known as the narrow leaf sedgeland, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, contributing to wetland biodiversity. Isolepis anceps plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
